forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. Southwest wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Light Rain then Mostly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 11am. Mostly cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As dusk descends upon Downtown San Francisco, a soft blanket of clouds drapes the city, promising the faint whisper of rain later tonight. The air holds a mild chill, around the mid-fifties, while a gentle southwest breeze lightly rustles the leaves, underscoring the delicate transition from day to night. Shadows stretch across the streets, as the dimly glowing lights of the city reveal a landscape poised between the awakening of evening and the lingering remnants of daylight. The probability of rain, though understated, lingers in the atmosphere like an uninvited guest, with only a 20% chance of playful droplets making their entrance, hinting at potential but not definitive outcomes.

As tomorrow unfolds, a slight chance of rain lingers until late morning, encouraging those setting out early to don a light jacket or perhaps an umbrella, just in case. The clouds are set to persist, veiling the sun’s rays and keeping daytime temperatures close to the low sixties, gradually retreating to the cooler embrace of the late afternoon. The marine layer, while gentle, does hint at a foggy embrace, particularly near the coastline, swirling around the Golden Gate Bridge yet leaving the heart of the city relatively clear. A stroll through the nearby parks or along the waterfront might be a refreshing choice, as the cool breeze encourages an evening’s exploration of local cafés or art galleries, embracing the ambience of a fog-kissed San Francisco night.
